CatDescriptText: Rina Balter, teacher, Shadyside, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I would say to him that the only demonstration that he could give to the world that he really wants peace is to stop the atomic bomb testing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rina Balter wearing dark coat with squiggled patterned buttons and dark patterned scarf, posed in front of building with advertisement for dog food, Downtown
